alert.note: Alert for Boone; Campbell; Kenton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, NORTHERN RIPLEY, DEARBORN, NORTHERN KENTON, NORTHERN CAMPBELL, NORTHERN BOONE, CENTRAL HAMILTON AND WEST CENTRAL CLERMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 207 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Osgood to Claryville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Florence, Independence, Norwood, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Newport, Harrison, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, Cheviot, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Highland Heights, Taylor Mill, Batesville, Bellevue and Fort Wright. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 8. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 150 and 161, and between mile markers 163 and 165. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 4 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 177 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If these storms become stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
